info.title: Content Moderator Client
info.description:
You use the API to scan your content as it is generated. Content Moderator then processes your content and sends the results along with relevant information either back to your systems or to the built-in review tool. You can use this information to take decisions e.g. take it down, send to human judge, etc.

When using the API, images need to have a minimum of 128 pixels and a maximum file size of 4MB. 
Text can be at most 1024 characters long. 
If the content passed to the text API or the image API exceeds the size limits, the API will return an error code that informs about the issue.

post.description: Returns the list of faces found.
Returns any text found in the image for the language specified. If no language is specified in input then the detection defaults to English.

200.description: The text found and list of candidate text details.

post.description: Returns probabilities of the image containing racy or adult content.

Fuzzily match an image against one of your custom Image Lists. You can create and manage your custom image lists using this API. Returns ID and tags of matching image.

Note: Refresh Index must be run on the corresponding Image List before additions and removals are reflected in the response.

200.description:
Supported values for tags are:
  • 101: Nudity
  • 102: Sexual Content
  • 201: Alcohol
  • 202: Tobacco
  • 203: Drugs
  • 301: Child Exploitation
  • 401: Violence
  • 402: Weapons
  • 403: Gore
  • 501: Profanity
  • 502: Vulgarity
.

post.summary: Detect profanity and match against custom and shared blacklists
post.description: Detects profanity in more than 100 languages and match against custom and shared blacklists.
This operation will detect the language of given input content. Returns the ISO 639-3 code for the predominant language comprising the submitted text. Over 110 languages supported.

get.description: Returns the details of the image list with list Id equal to list Id passed.

delete.description: Deletes image list with the list Id equal to list Id passed.

put.description: Updates an image list with list Id equal to list Id passed.

post.description: Creates an image list.
Refreshes the index of the list with list Id equal to list Id passed.

get.description: Returns list Id details of the term list with list Id equal to list Id passed.

delete.description: Deletes term list with the list Id equal to list Id passed.

post.description: Creates a Term List
Refreshes the index of the list with list Id equal to list ID passed.
Add an image to the list with list Id equal to list Id passed.

delete.description: Deletes all images from the list with list Id equal to list Id passed.

get.description: Gets all image Ids from the list with list Id equal to list Id passed.

delete.description: Deletes an image from the list with list Id and image Id passed.

post.description: Add a term to the term list with list Id equal to list Id passed.

delete.description: Deletes a term from the list with list Id equal to the list Id passed.

get.description: Gets all terms from the list with list Id equal to the list Id passed.

delete.description: Deletes all terms from the list with list Id equal to the list Id passed.

get.description: Returns review details for the review Id passed.
Get the Job Details for a Job Id.

post.description:
The reviews created would show up for Reviewers on your team. As Reviewers complete reviewing, results of the Review would be POSTED (i.e. HTTP POST) on the specified CallBackEndpoint.

CallBack Schemas

Review Completion CallBack Sample

{
"ReviewId": "",
"ModifiedOn": "2016-10-11T22:36:32.9934851Z",
"ModifiedBy": "",
"CallBackType": "Review",
"ContentId": "",
"Metadata": {
"adultscore": "0.xxx",
"a": "False",
"racyscore": "0.xxx",
"r": "True"
},
"ReviewerResultTags": {
"a": "False",
"r": "True"
}
}

.

A job Id will be returned for the content posted on this endpoint. Once the content is evaluated against the Workflow provided the review will be created or ignored based on the workflow expression.

CallBack Schemas

Job Completion CallBack Sample


{
"JobId": ",
"ReviewId": "",
"WorkFlowId": "default",
"Status": "",
"ContentType": "Image",
"ContentId": "",
"CallBackType": "Job",
"Metadata": {
"adultscore": "0.xxx",
"a": "False",
"racyscore": "0.xxx",
"r": "True"
}
}

Review Completion CallBack Sample


{ "ReviewId": "",
"ModifiedOn": "2016-10-11T22:36:32.9934851Z",
"ModifiedBy": "",
"CallBackType": "Review",
"ContentId": "",
"Metadata": {
"adultscore": "0.xxx", "a": "False",
"racyscore": "0.xxx",
"r": "True"
},
"ReviewerResultTags": {
"a": "False",
"r": "True"
}
}

.

post.description: Publish video review to make it available for review.

put.description: This API adds a transcript screen text result file for a video review. Transcript screen text result file is a result of Screen Text API . In order to generate transcript screen text result file , a transcript file has to be screened for profanity using Screen Text API.
This API adds a transcript file (text version of all the words spoken in a video) to a video review. The file should be a valid WebVTT format.

The reviews created would show up for Reviewers on your team. As Reviewers complete reviewing, results of the Review would be POSTED (i.e. HTTP POST) on the specified CallBackEndpoint.

Use this method to add frames for a video review.Timescale: This parameter is a factor which is used to convert the timestamp on a frame into milliseconds. Timescale is provided in the output of the Content Moderator video media processor on the Azure Media Services platform.Timescale in the Video Moderation output is Ticks/Second.

Timescale is provided in the output of the Content Moderator video media processor on the Azure Media Services platform.Timescale in the Video Moderation output is Ticks/Second.

Frames.description: The response for a Get Frames request.

Category2.description: The category2 score details of the text. Click here for more details on category classification.

Category3.description: The category3 score details of the text. Click here for more details on category classification.

Text.description: Email Address in the input text content.

Index.description: Index(Location) of the Email address in the input text content.

Index(Location) of the Address in the input text content.
Index(Location) of the detected profanity term in the input text content.

FoundFaces.description: Request object the contains found faces.

OCR.description: Contains the text found in image for the language specified.

KeyValuePair.description: The key value pair object properties.

IsImageAdultClassified.description: Indicates if an image is classified as adult.

IsImageRacyClassified.description: Indicates if the image is classified as racy.

MatchResponse.description: The response for a Match request.

IsMatch.description: Indicates if there is a match.

Score.description: Confidence score of the image match.

ReviewerResultTags.description: Array of KeyValue with Reviewer set Tags.

TeamName.description: The team name associated with the job.

ReviewId.description: Review Id if one is created.

JobExecutionReport.description: Job execution report- Array of KeyValue pairs object.

APIError.description: Error information returned by the API

CallBackEndpoint.name: CallBackEndpoint
CallBackEndpoint.description: Callback endpoint for posting the create job result.

WorkflowName.name: WorkflowName
WorkflowName.description: Workflow Name that you want to invoke.

ContentId.name: ContentId
ContentId.description: Id/Name to identify the content submitted.

subTeam.name: subTeam
subTeam.description: SubTeam of your team, you want to assign the created review to.

CacheImage.name: CacheImage
CacheImage.description: Whether to retain the submitted image for future use; defaults to false if omitted.

enhanced.name: enhanced
enhanced.description:
When set to True, the image goes through additional processing to come with additional candidates.

image/tiff is not supported when enhanced is set to true

Note: This impacts the response time.
